data.enText: a flower (usually one on a plant that people admire for its flowers)
the exotic blooms of the orchid

data.chText: 大多数玫瑰从五月末开始开花。
data.enText: Most roses will begin to bloom from late May.
to become healthy, happy or confident

data.chText: 孩子们在农场期间健康活泼有生气。
data.enText: The children had bloomed during their stay on the farm.

ex.enText: It produces pink or white blooms.

synonyms.bx: 主要指植物开的花及开花的状态。

ex.chText: 那些玫瑰已经长出了花蕾。
ex.enText: The roses have come into bud.

ex.chText: 植物学家将这种花归入蔷薇科。
ex.enText: Botanists classify this flower as part of the rose family.
A single flower does not make a spring.

ex.chText: 等花园中所有的植物都开花时，他们就会结婚。
ex.enText: They will get married when all the plants in the garden are in flower.

synonyms.bx: 指开放的花朵，也可泛指花卉。

tr: a powdery deposit on a surface
reproductive organ of angiosperm plants especially one having showy or colorful parts
the organic process of bearing flowers
example: you will stop all bloom if you let the flowers go to seed

tr: a rosy color (especially in the cheeks) taken as a sign of good health
the period of greatest prosperity or productivity

value.def: A bloom is the flower on a plant.

example.ex: ...the sweet fragrance of the white blooms...

example.tran: 哈里小心翼翼地摘下那朵花。

value.def: A plant or tree that is in bloom has flowers on it.

example.ex: ...a pink climbing rose in full bloom.
...the sweet smell of the blackberry in bloom.

value.def: When a plant or tree blooms, it produces flowers. When a flower blooms, it opens.

example.ex: This plant blooms between May and June.
example.tran: 这种植物在5月至6月间开花。

value.def: If someone or something blooms, they develop good, attractive, or successful qualities.

example.ex: Not many economies bloomed in 1990, least of all gold exporters like Australia...
example.tran: 1990年经济繁荣的国家并不多，尤其是像澳大利亚这样的黄金出口国。

example.ex: She bloomed into an utterly beautiful creature.

value.tran: 繁荣；兴盛；茁壮成长；变漂亮

value.def: If something such as someone's skin has a bloom, it has a fresh and healthy appearance.

example.ex: The skin loses its youthful bloom.
example.tran: 皮肤失去了年轻时的光泽。

value.tran: （肤色的）红润，健康的光彩；容光

trans: 青春；风华正茂；绽放青春；与青春有关的日子；青春风华正茂
